definition: the whole room roaring with laughter (idiom)
tumult/uproar/commotion/disturbance
to deceive/to coax/to amuse (a child)
variant of 鬨|哄[hong4]
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
old variant of 笑[xiao4]
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: There was a moment of silence, then everyone but the Princess began to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 片刻寂静之后，皇族贵胄们哄堂大笑，除了公主。

sentences.english: His jokes set the whole room in an uproar.
sentences.chinese: 他的笑话引得全屋的人哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: The audience laughed so much that their laughter forced me to run way long.
sentences.chinese: 观众的多次哄堂大笑迫使我在演讲过程中停顿了好久。

sentences.english: The audience roared at the farce.
His slip of tongue brought titters from the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他的口误引起了人群的哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: It is illegal to wear a fake moustache that causes laughter in church.
sentences.chinese: 它是非法的，戴上假胡子在教堂引起哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: When he had finished, the audience burst into a laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他说完以后，听众哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: He convulsed the audience with his jokes.
sentences.chinese: 他以笑话使观众哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: He convulsed the audience with his funny acts.
sentences.chinese: 他以滑稽的动作使观众哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: He often sets the table a-roaring with a well-placed bon mot.
sentences.chinese: 他经常以恰到好处的珠玑妙语使满桌的人哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: The crowd laugh an guffaw as soon as they see the ridiculous manner of the buffoon.
sentences.chinese: 大家一见小丑那种滑稽样子，立刻哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: The crowd laugh and guffaw as soon as they see the ridiculous manner of the buffoon.
sentences.chinese: 大家一见小丑那种滑稽样子立刻哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: Gordon's jokes produced a great deal of laughter.
sentences.chinese: 哥顿的笑话引起了哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: Well, of course, I roared with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 当而然之的，我哄堂大笑起来。

definition: to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
boisterous/uproarious
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to snigger/to titter
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
to rock one's body backward and forward/to be convulsed (with laughter etc)
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
off the stage/in the audience
to whisper
to split one's sides laughing
to whisper to one another's ear
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
